result.heading: IN MEMORY OF NATALIE "ALICE" SHELDRAKE M

direction.raw_text: Next to the stone a funeral urn.  A YOUNG MINISTER gropes for meaning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know Richard Sheldrake personally, but his many friends who knew and worked with him, wanted to make sure that he was returned home, here, to be remembered with his beloved wife... Chuck gazes out at the sleepy harbor, the minister's voice fading away.  The afternoon wind is coming up with the tide.  He quietly heads towards the water.  Drifting, drawn, lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Though he had moved on with his life, now even for the years, to hear him eulogized by strangers, seemed strange.  He had been a hewner of stones, a pilot by the silent stars.  Like me, alone among many.  But most of all for us, the crew of the brigantine Albatross, he was always and would forever be... our Skipper. A SHIP'S BELL turns him around.  Ding ding.  Ding ding.  A beautiful three masted schooner steady on the water slips into port.  A picture out of another time, another place. It takes him away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gonna jump?  Or are you just having a last look?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was just thinking that I never had a new pair of shoes till I was twelve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's no my fault I was born first. Besides, nobody ever sent me on an eight month vacation, so ease up on the sad sack stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not a vacation, it's private school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought this was your dream come true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not why he's sending me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it looks good. Chuck looks out, yearning.  Will considers him, troubled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just not like you.  Ya know? I'm never going to go to Yale.  I'm never going to be "William".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody says you have to be like me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't give him enough credit Chas. Chuck takes a last look at the building clouds.  The sky rumbles.  Distant thunder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We better go. EXT.  GIEG HOUSE - DAY Maple street, USA, tree lined and quaint.  The Gieg home is a modest two story house with a covered porch.  The family station wagon is poised for departure.  CHARLES, 45, a generally serious man broods as MIDDY, their mother, 40, soft and thoughtful, exits the house.  Chuck and Will appear from the woods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ticked) You plan on making this plane or not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't take any wooden nickels Kemosabe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I won't. Will shoves out a hand at Chuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And lighten up will ya. Chuck hugs him anyway and walks to the passenger side. Charles tosses him the keys, like he's doing him a big favor. INT.  CAR - DAY Chuck sits in the drivers seat.  Middy is in the back. Charles slams the trunk and gets in.  Before Chuck turns the ignition...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now just take it easy.  We're not going to a fire. Chuck reacts. OUTSIDE Will watches as the car pulls away. CAR - MOVING The Giegs drive in silence.  Middy reads from a brochure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey, did you know that the Albatross was captured by the Germans during World War II?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I didn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It says she was originally Schooner rigged, but Captain Sheldrake turned her into a brigantine.  I think square rigs look so much more romantic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Appearances aren't everything.  Keep your mind on the road. Chuck pulls over to the side of the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing? Chuck hands him the keys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't feel like driving.  Okay? Charles regards him oddly. EXT.  AIRPORT GATE - DAY The National Airlines Boeing 707 is bigger than anything Chuck has ever seen.  Passengers begin boarding.  Charles stands away, detached.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have your ticket?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Passport?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I just better go. Middy hugs her son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye Mom.  I'll be okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you will. Chuck faces his dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make us proud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir. Charles extends his hand.  They shake.  Then Chuck hurries away into the crowd.  Charles and Middy watch until he is out of sight. INT.  PLANE - DAY Chuck settles into his seat next to the window.  He watches as the world slips away beneath the wings of the 707. EXT.  AIRPORT CUSTOMS - BERMUDA - DAY Another world.  Chuck stands in line at the customs booth. He cranes his neck to see the brilliant blue water and coral reefs beyond the runway. Three other boys are ahead of him in line.  The CUSTOMS AGENTS go through every piece of luggage.  TOD JOHNSTONE, 16, thin and blonde, is in a heated argument with one of the agents about his spear gun. RICK MARCH, 17, wise-cracking and confident, shakes his head, smiling.  He spots Chuck, moves through the line and shoves out a hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Albatross?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rick March.  Who the hell are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gieg, Chuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, meet us out front when you're through.  If they try to take anything away from you like Johnny Quest up there, just make a list and we'll have 'em send it down to the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever. One of the agent starts pulling things out of Rick's duffel bag.  He finds a dive knife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, hey!!  That's my stuff!! EXT.  AUSTIN CAB - MOVING - DAY The car whizzes through the narrow streets of Bermuda. CALYPSO MUSIC sings from the radio.  The streets are lined with small coral houses and exotic palms. INT.  CAR - SAME The boys are jammed inside with their things.  In addition to Chuck, Rick and Tod, is CHARLIE STRATTON, also sixteen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well Ricky boy, spear gun or no, it's sweet to be back in the world of rum and honey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta admit I never thought you'd be back after the great "Bowsprit Affair".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me and Skipper had a meeting of the minds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I begged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (warming a little) What the "Bowsprit Affair"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Romeo here was on harbor watch and managed to sweet talk one of the local girls to have a go in the bowsprit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not just any 'local' girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The 'local' mayor's 'local' daughter. Tod smiles, reminiscing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thing is, the net in the basket isn't very comfortable, so Tod-o wraps them up in the jib.  After the deed was done...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says they did the deed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trust me, we did the deed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After the "alleged" deed was done, they fell asleep.  Big Daddy Lawford comes on deck at four bells and hears Casanova sawing logs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe me, I needed the rest...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gets the whole crew on deck, gets us on the halyard, and orders the old "heave ho...".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up goes the jib and out roll Tod-o and the mayor's daughter, naked as pilot whales...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Tod) I don't know who was more surprised, you or Big Daddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To tell you the truth, I think it was her father. At the top of a hill, the harbor comes into view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well gentlemen, there she is. The cab stops.  Besides many colorful fishing boats, is the ALBATROSS.  At ninety-two feet, she dwarfs everything in the harbor.  Her white hull glows like ivory and her twin masts and yard arms tower above her deck. Breathtaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Home sweet hell on the water. EXT.  DOCK - DAY The boys pile out of the taxi.  What seemed like a pristine ship from the hill looks like a rust bucket up close.  The white paint is streaked and barnacles cover the hull.  Looks of disappointment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to it? A voice from behind turns Chuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She cleans up.  We'll have her ship shape before we shove off. This is BILL BUTLER, 15, removed, the youngest of the crew and... first mate.  Bill gives Chuck a friendly slap on the back and climbs aboard.  He is greeted by a Viking giant of a man, LAWFORD, 37, and bearded, the ship's English professor. Puffing on a huge Havana cigar, he stares coolly down at Tod and the others.  He speaks with the voice of Moses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "That this same child of honor and renown, This gallant Hotspur, this all praised knight, And your unthought-of Harry chance to meet. For every honor sitting on his helm, Would they were multitudes, and on my head.  My shames redoubled!  For the time will come... Chuck feels something and looks up where he meets the intense stare of a man standing between the deck cabins. Their eyes lock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... That I shall make this northern youth exchange, his glorious deeds for my indignities." Then, the man is gone.  Haunting.  Only Chuck has seen him.  Tod smiles back at Lawford impishly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you be addressing me, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that supposed to mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) Henry the IV part I Act I Scene ii. I suggest you read it. Lawford sneers and walks away.  It's all a show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It means Shakespeare.  B-o-r-i-n-g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It means if he catches anybody basket-napping on watch this passage, he's gonna use their lizard for 'cuda' bait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (lightly) Well that's a hell of a how-do-you- do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drop your gear, go below and pick yourself some bunks. Chuck and the others climb aboard. INT.  MAIN CABIN - DAY Chuck makes his way down the companionway into the main cabin.  Other crew members are already unpacking. The sleeping arrangement is Pullman-style with two rows of bunks on each side of the cabin.  In the middle of the room is a gimbaled table.  This is where the crew will eat and study.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen up.  This is Chuck Gieg. Among the crew -- feature ROBIN WEATHERS, 16, a cherub with soft puffy cheeks and TERRY LAPCHICK, 17, skinny and rodent-like. Robin approaches with a hand extended.  He carries a 8x10 photo of a young man in a football uniform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Robin. Chuck regards the photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (flat) That's my brother.  He's dead. Apprehensively Chuck shakes and retreats to a lower bunk. Robin tacks up the picture above his bunk.  Terry unpacks in front of one of the lower berths. A loud "THUD!" turns everyone around.  A duffel bag lies at the bottom of the companionway.  A large imposing figure climbs into the cabin. This is JOHN GOODALL, 17, over six feet, big and broad. His hair is slicked back "Dean" style and wears a full day's growth of bread on his face.  Compared to the others, he looks all man.  Everybody clears from his path. He stops in front of the lower, center bunk (Terry's bunk) and drops his bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take this one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You probably didn't notice, but this bunk has been taken. John just glares at him, then dumps all of Terry's things onto the blanket on the bunk, gathers it up and tosses it into the remaining upper berth.  Terry watches, intimidated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anybody gotta problem with that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) Absolutely not. John climbs into his bunk and closes his eyes.  Bill enters, followed by several adults. DR. ALICE SHELDRAKE, 30, smart, attractive and tough, is ship's surgeon and Skipper's wife.  Lawford appears with GEORGE PASCAL, 30's from Brazil, dark, and fit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, listen up.  This is Dr. Alice Sheldrake. The guys stumble over only half listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm ship's surgeon.  I'm in charge of aches, pains, biology, math and science.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George Pascal here is ship's cook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you want to keep all your fingers, stay the hell out of my galley unless you're invited.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some of you already know Mr. Lawford.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have been charged with the dubious task of insuring your literary education. Lawford puts a hand on Bill's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill Butler is your first mate.  But don't let his size fool you. Bill gives a half reluctant wave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So when the hell do we get to meet El Capitan? Snickering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (aside) Maybe he's getting his wooden leg waxed. Laughter.  A sound stops the laughter.  Almost on cue, the sound of slow methodical footsteps, pace the deck above them.  Then a shadow falls across the skylight, blocking the light.  Ominous.  They all notice and look up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mysterious) You'll meet him.  Soon enough. INT.  MAIN CABIN - SUNRISE Dawn glows orange in the skylights above the cabin.  The only sound is the heavy, even breathing of slumber. Suddenly, a booming voice rumbles down the companionway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arise, Arise, Arise... Chuck wakes, disoriented.  Terry bolts upright and hits his head on the low ceiling.  Ouch. Tod, Rick and Charlie are up instantly.  Lawford's voice echoes through the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exultation is the going/ Of an inland soul to sea/ Past the houses/ Past the headlands/ Into deep Eternity/ Bred as we, among the mountains/ Can the sailor understand/ the divine intoxication/ of the first league out from land? (pause) But I suppose we'll answer that question soon enough gentlemen. Soon enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What question? Chuck tries to assimilate Lawford's words.  Robin swings his feet over the side of his bunk with a tortured look. John rolls over and pulls his pillow over his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (foggy) What the hell is going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it's an air raid. In crisply pressed shorts and shirt, Bill Butler steps through the aft bulkhead.  He raises a bowswain's  whistle and blows.  OOOWWWEEEEOOO!!!!  Chuck and Robin grab their ears.  It's a nightmare.  Terry jumps and hits his head again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roll out sailors!  All hands on deck!  Sixty seconds.  Sixty seconds. He blows the whistle again.  This time it brings even John to his feet, staring down at Bill in a blind rage.  Bill looks up and casually notices him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gotta problem Goodall?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You blow that thing again I'll shove it so far up your ass, you're gonna need dental floss to get it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just get on deck. Bill turns and disappears topside. EXT.  DECK - DAWN The sun has barely cracked the horizon as the crew staggers onto the deck, shirtless and shivering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Line up!  Single file.  Single file. The crew lines up.  John is the last one through the hatch and he lets us know his boundaries are being pressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody swims. The boys are aghast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't think people, just go!  Go, Go, Go, Go, Go!!!  Swim you win, stay you pay!! Rick is the first one through the gunnel door, followed by Tod and Charlie.  They howl and scream as they hit the water.  The rest follow like lemmings.  But John stands defiantly with his arms folded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now what's the problem, Goodall? Everybody swims. The crew are piling back on deck.  George stands in the open galley door.  The smell of fresh bacon is intoxicating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will if you wanna eat.  Right George? George nods, wielding a butchers knife.  The crew stand shivering, waiting on John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Bill) You gonna swim for your breakfast? Bill gives John a long look then strips to his shorts, swings into the rigging and climbs up to the first yard arm.  He looks down at the water some twenty-five feet below.  It's a long way.  Robin turns away. Lawford booms in a voice that echoes across the harbor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Down, down beneath the deep, That oft in triumph bore him, He sleeps a sound and peaceful sleep, With the salt waves dashing over him." -- Lord Byron gentlemen. With that Bill leaps and hits the water with a huge KERSPLASH!  He swims to the boarding ladder, pulls himself up and gets in John's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody swims.  Now, I've been in twice.  So I guess I'll be eating your breakfast too. John considers him, then strips off his shirt.  But instead of walking over to the gunnel door, he jumps into the ratlines, climbs to the foretop and looks down. He manages a thin smile then climbs to the second set of ratlines past the third yard and continues to the top yard arm -- the topgallant.  It's a pissing contest and everybody knows it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got five bucks says he doesn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got five that says he doesn't live.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll take a dollar of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is crazy! Robin refuses to watch.  The others share a look. John makes his way along the foot ropes and stands at the end of the yard.  He tosses a look towards Bill but with no way to back down, he launches into the air.  Everyone gasps as he thunders through the air in a broad swan dive. Falling, falling, falling...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't watch this. John hits the water like a bullet.  The crew run to the side waiting for him to come up.  Nothing.  Finally, he breaks the surface.  Easy.  He climbs up waiting, somehow, to claim victory. Suddenly, they all feel it.  A presence.  He has appeared silently on top of the Chart House, like a phantom gazing down at them, back lit by the sun the boys must squint to see him. RICHARD SHELDRAKE, (SKIPPER), ageless and windswept, casually reaches up to a block and tackle with one arm and glides to the deck.  He is powerfully built and bronzed from the sea and sun.  He carriers the burden of command like a cross.  Soft-spoken and remote, he is a man to be reckoned with.  The crew know they are in the presence of someone larger than life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skipper on deck! The crew line up clumsily.  Skipper has a gaze that blazes right through them. He looks out to sea.  Searching, ominous.  He waits until the silence is filled with everyone's attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what's out there?  Wind and wave and rain.  Endless glassy pools that'll hold a sailing ship for weeks and then spit her out into the eye of the kind of hurricane.  A blow that could knock the bridge off a battleship.  Reefs and rocks and sandbars that'll tear the belly from her and enough fog and night to hide it all. He spits into the water.  The crew sheepishly throw glances to the horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So look out there... and explain to me why any man in possession of any sense at all, would take on the sea with sail? Skipper turns his gaze back to the boys.  There is a fire in his eyes.  Nobody dare answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because there's something else out there.  It beckons in the wind and sings in the shrouds.  Voices. Whispering... His ear to the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're voices of men.  Calling.  Men you don't even know.  Men you can't even imagine.  It's a seed, a wish, that part of you and I that aches to be alive, that was banished by everything we've ever been taught or told.  It's a part of us that can only be found on mountain tops and deserts, in the deepest caverns, smoking battle fields and... across oceans. He turns back to the sea, dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out there, is where it all waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was everything I had expected, part Ahab part Queeg and even Bligh. He spoke in whispers and answered all queries with efficiency and directness.  He had gone to sea for the first time at fifteen, the same age as Bill Butler.  And as he looked upon us that first day it must have been as though he were staring into a mirror. Skipper manages a sobering look and climbs on top of the chart house.  He pats a small brass sign that is welded to the main mast and reads the inscription.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reading) "Where we go one, we go all." With that, he disappears below.  Nobody moves.  This is exactly the kind of man you want around when the shit hits the fan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This -- is gonna be a long eight months. INT.  MAIN CABIN - DAY The boys devour a hearty breakfast.  Tod is the 'galley slave' and fills glasses with orange juice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chow down boys.  The milk and eggs are the first things to go once we put out. John enters balancing two plates heaped with food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know we gotta dumbwaiter for that. John looks over to the dumbwaiter mounted in the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not that one.  Tod-o here. The guys groan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Har, har, har... John approaches the full table, glaring down at Terry who doesn't notice him.  Finally he looks up, startled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm done.  I'm finished... He scrambles to get up and clear his plate.  John sits down without a word.  The others notice the two plates of food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hungry, Goodall? He just grunts and starts eating.  Robin watches him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd you jump?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I felt like it. (sharp) What do you care?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (aside) I couldn't do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, as soon as you grow some balls, let me know. Robin bristles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Screw you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's right.  It was a stupid stunt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard me. John grabs Charlie by his private parts and hoists him into the air.  Charlie gasps, the air sucked from his lungs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't ever call me stupid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, he didn't mean anything. John shoves Robin to the floor with his free arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me tell you girls something.  I do what I wanna do.  When I wanna do it.  And I don't give a shit what old Ahab up there thinks either. Any questions? John releases Charlie who crumples to the floor.  John resumes eating. Bill enters and reads the duty roster.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, here's the duty.  Gieg, Weathers, Lapchick, Schucart: scrape and paint.  Corry and Stricklin have the brass.  Robinson, you're the Galley slave.  March you're on chain gang with Barnes. Johnston, solo on bilge detail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Butler, what'd I ever do to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You came back, Tod.  You came back. John continues to eat.  When he realizes his name hasn't been called, he looks up to meet Bill's eyes. INT.  HEAD Pissed, John tries to figure out the head.  Pumps going in, pumps going out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were all thirteen individuals. We'd arrived the sum total of our limited experiences and the result of our parents' best, if not narrow, expectations... John pulls back on the lever, belching "water de le toilet" all over him. EXT.  SHIP - DAY Chuck sits in a bowswain's chair over the side, with a paint roller in his hand.  The rust-streaked hull is being transformed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Some of us were there for discipline, some for escape.  But I could see a small piece of myself in all of them and though I fought the notion, for me, I knew now, this would be home. A RADIO crackles in the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "President Eisenhower today acknowledged that a secret American spy plane was in fact shot down over the Soviet Union.  The pilot has been confirmed as Francis Gary Powers..." Robin, Terry and Mike, are on the deck within earshot of Chuck with chisels and wire brushes chipping away at the rust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why couldn't it have been a wooden boat?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steel boats don't leak. Mike lights up a cigarette.  Robin notices.  Marlboro's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, can I have one? Mike sizes up Robin for a moment then tosses him the pack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks daddy-o. Robin lights up, grimacing with the first drag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, don't brush too hard.  Looks to me like the only thing holding this bucket together is the rust. A voice booms up from the dock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahoy there. They turn.  Standing on the dock is FRANCIS BOUTILLIER, self important and overbearing, with his son, PHILIP, who looks as if this whole ordeal is some kind of punishment. Skipper appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good afternoon. Francis boards without being invited.  Philip follows in his shadow.  He scrutinizes the condition of the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Albatross?  Doesn't inspire a lot of confidence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, on the contrary, the Albatross is considered a very good omen.  It is said they embody the spirits of sailors passed on.  It's very bad luck if you kill one.  And dolphins too. The boys chuckle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Francis Boutillier.  This is my son, Philip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Francis looks the Skipper over, reading him, smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a day late.  We keep a schedule aboard ship.  Lives depend on it. (to Philip) Hello, Philip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir. Skipper's directness bugs Francis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your cable said you wouldn't be putting out until mid-October.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As you can see, there's a lot to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Indentured servitude is not what my son had in mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a working ship.  Promptness is not a luxury, it's a necessity, as is the work to maintain her.  Had we been ready, I can assure you we would have sailed. Something in this exchange turns the tone of conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I would have expected compensation for my time and expense coming all the way down here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Happily, it all worked out... This time. (to Bill) Bill, take Philip below and help him find a bunk. Phil follows Bill down the companionway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be frank with you.  This was his mother's idea.  A romp through the Caribbean on a sailboat sounds more like a vacation than an education if you ask me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It will be more than that, I can promise you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cool) Take good care of my son. There is threat in his tone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll do our best.  You're welcome to say goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a big boy. Francis leaves the boat.  Skipper and the crew watch as he climbs into his waiting embassy limousine and drives off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that was neighborly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He didn't get to be Under Secretary of the Air Force by being neighborly. Lawford shakes his head.  Bill comes up through the companionway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone aboard young Bill?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. (beat) Let's go sailing. EXT.  ALBATROSS - OPEN WATER - DAY The Albatross is under full power.  There is a sense of excitement and anticipation.  Charlie, Rick, Robin, and Lawford are on the halyard for the mainsail.  Skipper is at the helm with Alice and Bill nearby.  Skipper calls over to Chuck who stands alone at the rail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come over here and take the wheel. Chuck's eyes light up as he walks over and takes the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold her steady into the wind. Southwest by west.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to all) Gentleman, when you hear an order, sing out.  I want to know that you've heard and understand. (quietly to Bill) Raise the mainsail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling out) Raise the main! Lawford and his group bellow out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raise the main!! Lawford coaches the boys, sending two scurrying on top the chart house to loosen the stops which hold the heavy furled canvas to the main boom.  He guides another to the midships pinrail where the main halyard, which raises the huge sail, is made fast to a belaying pin.  He loosens the halyard and hands it to Robin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a turn under the pin and lead it out to the others.  You guys in the rear take up the slack.  Heave together now... In a beautiful tenor voice, Bill begins to croon a sea chanty, an old whaling song with an Irish lilt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (singing) "When the sun came up there was whisky in the cup..." The more experienced boys echo the line and pull to the beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "When the sun came up there was whisky in the cup..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on the rest of you, sing!  Belt it out like men!! The newer guys like Chuck, John, Robin and Terry look at each other like this is the queerest thing they have ever heard of.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (singing) "Not one of us was a sober..." The boys return the verse half heartedly.  Lawford ties off his line and stares them down.  Skipper notices that the work has stopped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong Mr. Lawford.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It seems we're short on singers. Skipper walks amid ship and addresses the crew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone sings aboard a wind jammer gentlemen.  It lets everyone know you're in sync.  It shows unity, that all thoughts are one.  A crew that sings together stays together. Besides, I like it.  So, pipe up and be sailors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in a whisper) Everybody swims, everybody sings... What's next?  Tap dancing? Lawford and Rick leap up onto the line pulling it down with their body weight.  They sing out the chorus.  The crew returns the song, somewhat reluctantly as the great mainsail starts to rise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tie it off!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Bill) Outer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outer Jib!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (confused) Outta what? Coached by Tod, another group in the bow, awkwardly hoist the jib.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Bill) We'll bear off to port and run down wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Lawford, stand by to ease the mainsheet.  Rick, get on the jib sheet.  George, John, Philip, Tim and Dick go aloft to unstop the forecourse.  George will show you what to do.  Tod, show your men the forward pinrail and stand ready on the buntlines and clewlines. Forecourse first... work upward. The newcomers watch Bill with new-found respect.  George, John and the others climb to the forecourse, and out onto the footropes.  It's unsteady work and there's confusion everywhere.  But through it all, they continue to sing. Lawford moves to the mainsheet on the port side while the others move into their positions.  When Bill sees the yardarm crew is in place...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unstop the squares!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unstop the squares!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Chuck) Fall off to port.  Ease her around to a heading of northeast.  Sing out when you're there. As the tops are released, the giant forecourse drapes into a scalloped pattern.  As the bow falls off the wind the snapping main and jib billow.  Stiffening to the wind, the ship heels and surges forward. Before her awakening power, everyone changes their stance and grabs for a handhold.  Lawford slowly pays out the mainsheet while the forecourse crew move up the ratlines releasing the stops on the other squaresails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in a whisper) Ah... Northeast... sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (barking) Speak up boy! Chuck jumps, startled.  He self-consciously calls out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Northeast sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unfurl the squares! Tod's group first uncleats the clewlines and buntlines and the great squaresail drops and billows to fullness sending a shudder through the rig.  The bow's wake sizzles with the added surge.  As each of the squares fall, Alice and Lawford move to their sheets, setting each sail's position. Chuck looks up, amazed at the sheer magnitude and beauty of the canvas that the Albatross carries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Raise the inner jib!  Raise the forestaysail!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch the tell-tales Chuck.  If we jibe now we'll have a lot of people in the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All stop on the engine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All stop on the engine! Bill rotates the telegraph handle back and forth and moves it to the stop position.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Behold gentlemen.  The power of the wind! As the sails billow the Albatross seems transformed. Everyone stops and looks up.  The vessel heels and with a powerful surge, launches into the waves.  White foam splashes over the bowsprit as the hull thunders through the water.  Chuck's face is full of wonder.  It is a magical moment.  Then the crew begins to cheer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did we lose anybody?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not yet. LONG SHOT The Albatross under full sail is the handsome, powerful image of another time.  And yet, here she is. ON DECK Each of the boys is awed by the majesty of this moment. Music builds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chart us a course for the windward side. Alice considers his request.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That low passed through last night. May be a little bumpy out there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's time these boys saw some real blue water. EXT.  THE OPEN SEA - LATER The bow of the Albatross explodes through the top of a fifteen foot swell.  The sky is clear but the wind is fierce.  In spite of the seas the ship is trimmed and sailing well. The crew has never seen mountains of water like this. Disaster seems imminent.  Bill has assembled them in front of the wheel house.  They are all holding on for dear life.  Even John seems shaken.  Skipper magically stands effortlessly before them on the rolling deck.  He remains perfectly dry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... now that I have your undivided attention... I'd like to take this opportunity to make a few points...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (aside) This guy is certifiable...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suicidal...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The first thing is I don't like people talking when I'm talking so the two of you, shut up. Caught, Terry and Phil button up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Second, the next one of you who doesn't jump like a bunny when Mr. Butler gives an order is gonna spend the rest of this trip scrubbing bilges.  He's a better sailor today than any ten of you will be when this is all over. Skipper directs the next comment directly at John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if I catch anybody, ever, jumping off a yard arm again I will personally break what bones are left and send you home in a wheel chair. A wave explodes over the bow.  A wall of water crashes over the deck knocking down several of the boys.  Terry can't take it anymore and explodes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're gonna die!!!  We're all gonna die! He lunges at Skipper but Lawford one arms him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent point.  As you might have noticed, being out here pretty much puts you in the moment.  If you panic, if you lose your head, you die.  Maybe you take your mates with you.  How'd you like to have to bet on Terry here getting us home today? Each one of you is responsible for the rest.  "Where we go one, we go all".  If your buddy is asleep at the switch we're all fish food. He's making his point which is lost on no one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ship beneath you is not a toy and sailing is not a game.  The Albatross will take us far gentlemen, but she demands constant attention.  Respect her, and we'll do fine.  Oh, and one more thing. There is nothing that goes on, on this boat that I don't know about. She speaks to me in the night.  So don't test me.  Not even a little. Skipper walks over and puts an arm around Terry who is fighting sobs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing like experience to put things in perspective.  Huh son? (to Bill) Alright.  Let's go home. INT.  CHART HOUSE - DAY Lawford addresses some of the crew.  Chuck, Robin and John are among them.  John glares at Lawford.  The guys giggle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not a satisfactory answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, save it for somebody else will ya.  This ancient shit doesn't have anything to do with me. Lawford pauses for a moment and then explodes theatrically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit?!!! He slams a text book into John's hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Read for me please the words of Mr. Keats at the bottom of the page. John stares back, simmering.  Robin interrupts the potential confrontation and reaches for the book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll read it.  I mean I don't mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up donut. John pushes Robin's hands away and studies the page for a moment.  He begins reading but struggles with the cadence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (reading) Much have I traveled in realms of gold/ And many goodly states and kingdoms seen/ Round many western islands have I been/ Which bards in fealty to Apollo hold/ Oft of one wide expanse had I been told/ That deep-browed Homer ruled as his demesne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what he is talking about here? Blank faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ranting) Awe.  Humility.  He's telling you that he has traveled the seas as Homer did.  As Ulysses had before him as he tried to find his way home to Ithaca after the Trojan Wars. "That deep browed Homer"... He points to his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brilliant, seasoned, wise, of the mind; "... ruled as his demesne." He commands the voyage of the imagination, like a god. (pause) That is what one of the greatest literary minds of modern times, Mr. Boutillier, has to say about Homer. He snatches the book back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think the Odyssey is dull?  I'll tell you something, it's about each one of you -- right now.  Doubt and expectation.  Friendship, community, self sacrifice and accountability. He holds up the text.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't just a story!!  It's history made allegory.  It is a philosophical handbook for life!  It holds the secret of this very voyage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it... the secret? Lawford breaks into a huge belly laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (confused) What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it were only that simple, my young friend.  Read on, gentlemen. Read on. EXT.  ALBATROSS - ESTABLISHING - DAY Aerial shot.  The Albatross is under full sail leaving Bermuda for the last time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And so it was the Albatross that took to the open sea with the wind in her snapping canvas and a bone of white foam in her teeth... In each of us were feelings of anticipation and hesitation for the man at the wheel and of the unfamiliar world he was leading us into. She crashes through the surf -- driving, majestic music, building. DECK - DAY The crew hauls in the line, raising the mainsail.  Chuck struggles to coil the rope as fast as it is coming in. ALOFT The crew take turns racing up the ratlines into the rigging. BOWSPRIT NET The crew pull down the jib trying to furl it.  Most of the sail ends up dragging in the water. ABOVE The squaresails are dropped simultaneously. WIDE White foam boils from the bow of the Albatross as she crashes through the waves. AT THE WHEEL Alice smiles and puts her arms around Skipper's waist. It's coming together. FORETOP - SAME Skipper stands at the rail, looking out.  The seas are up and the masts are pitching widely from side to side. Chuck is high above the deck in the footropes, wrestling with one of the squaresails.  The pitching mast catches him by surprise and he slips.  He tumbles down, tangled in the lines.  A rope wraps around his neck, choking him. Robin looks up and sees him hanging helplessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill!!  Skipper!! Robin freezes.  Skipper leaps into the rigging like a spider and, in a few seconds, wrestles Chuck free and carries him down to the deck.  Chuck coughs, catching his breath.  The color is gone from Skipper's face.  This was a close call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was my fault.  I slipped. Alice examines Chuck, making sure he's okay.  Skipper turns to Robin, who is shaken.  He never raises his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you go up there? Robin stands silently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Speak up. Still nothing from Robin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's afraid to climb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? (to Robin) Is that true? Robin looks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why wasn't I made aware of this Bill?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's your job to know.  If something goes wrong up there, the other eighteen people aboard can't be wondering if he's gonna do his job or not. Skipper returns his gaze to Robin, measuring him. Finally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swing up, son.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trembling) What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up you go.  Right now. Robin reluctantly pulls himself up onto the first rung, then the second.  He stops and steals a peek up.  The mast is swaying.  He freezes, his lip starts to tremble.  All eyes are on him.  Phil chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have something to say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smug) No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then keep your mouth shut. Phil backs off, stunned.  Robin can't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Robin) What's it going to be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry won't cut it. Robin holds on frozen.  Skipper turns to the crew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Survival means discipline and assimilation.  There are no special cases here. (to Robin) Now, get going.  Get up there. Humiliated, a tear slips down his face.  Excruciating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you blubbering about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... Skipper jumps onto the backside of the ratlines.  His face is but inches from Robin's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One hand in front of the other son. We'll do it together. Robin reaches for the next rung.  He looks down.  Skipper growls at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't look down.  Look in my eyes! Climb!  We'll do it together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sobbing) I can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You climb damn it, or so help me I'll haul you to the foretop by your diaper and leave you there!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aaauuuhhh!!! Skipper gets right in his face and snarls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you hating this?!  Are you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate you, you son of a bitch!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Hate the fear inside of you! Climb like a man mister!  Hate it! Hate it away.  Hate your way up one more rung!!  Do it right now!! With every ounce of strength, Robin reaches for one more rung screaming as he reaches.  Skipper climbs and screams with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Auuuggghhh!!!! Robin clutches the rung with a death grip.  Then, he looks down.  His bladder releases.  Hot urine runs down his legs and splashes, steaming, onto the deck.  The crew is horrified.  Robin weeps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, god... Skipper backs off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't hate yourself.  Hate your weakness.  All right.  Get down. Robin climbs to the deck and falls in with the others, mortified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm only gonna say this one time. I'm not here to wipe noses and asses.  I'm not your mother.  Trust funds and blue blazers don't get you a thing out here.  You wanna act like babies, then get off my boat. Stunned, the crew is speechless.  Chuck instinctively goes to help Robin.  Skipper snaps like a turtle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Chuck) He can take care of himself. (to others) Any other 'phobias' I need to know about? Skipper fires a look towards Phil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent.  Bill, find Mr. Weathers a position to suit his condition. Skipper turns and then stops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remember something, sooner or later... we all have to face it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (aside) Face what? The question hangs in the air like a cloud. INT.  CHART HOUSE - DUSK The chart house is the communication and navigation center for the boat.  It also serves as the officers dining room. Skipper, Alice, Lawford, George, and Bill Butler sit around the small table sipping coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're awfully quiet tonight. The group remains silent.  Lawford and George exchange a glance.  Skipper catches it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something on your mind, George? George looks up and wipes his mouth with a napkin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you were too hard on Weathers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  I do. Skipper nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need to know what I'm working with; what their boundaries are. Their lives depend on it, and for that matter so does yours.  We've got to bring them together.  Make them a crew.  We're as strong as our weakest link and I don't want to find that out the hard way.  So, I will challenge them and they will come together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sarcastic) Yes sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know the best thing about being a Skipper is the worst thing.  It's all my responsibility.  So I'll tell you what George, you stay off of my bridge, and I'll stay out of your galley.  We'll get along that way. Everyone's quiet, but clear.  Skipper and Alice exit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fucking bastard. Lawford lets out a belly laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've seen him snatch the tail of the tempest and stuff it, screaming, into a bottle.  The bilges are full of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's been beyond the reach.  To the edge of the abyss and back.  He'll do well by us all George.  He's a real salt.  There's no malice in him and there's nothing more dear to him than his boys.  So sleep well my friend. Lawford seductively produces a pair of Havana cigars, passes one to George and winks. INT.  GALLEY - DUSK Robin leans over the sink elbow deep in dishwater watching through the cabin window, as the sun slips below the horizon.  Chuck stands in the doorway with a plate of food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How ya doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (without turning) Fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, I appreciate, you know, the concern and all, but like he said, I can take care of myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just brought you something to eat. Robin turns and notices the plate of food and nods.  They stand silently.  It's awkward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel like I got you into this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm used to spending a lot of time alone.  I guess that's what I thought it would be out here.  But, it's not is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) I'm sorry I left you hanging up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't matter.  Really.  I'm just sorry you got chewed out. Robin nods.  They both stare out at the rising moon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My brother and I used to climb to the top of this old beech tree in the back yard and watch the moon come up just like this.  My parents would fight all the time so we'd sneak out there where we couldn't hear 'em and recite scenes from our favorite movies. Robin grows quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you believe I miss it?  The middle of paradise and I'm homesick. Chuck smiles and puts a hand on his back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ironic) Well, I wouldn't worry.  It'll all be there when we get back. EXT.  DECK - DAY The sky is dark and a storm is building and the boat rolls and pitches.  Chuck sees Terry heaving over the side. John and Tod hear the sound and turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (disgusted) Come on man.  Show a little backbone! (to Tod) You believe that?! Tod is fixated on Terry.  Suddenly, without warning, he breaks for the rail and lets fly. Phil and Charlie are next.  Chris climbs through the companionway but doesn't make it to the side.  Spontaneous regurgitation.  Bill and Lawford jump up onto the wheel housing to avoid being sprayed.  Suddenly everyone is heaving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Bill) We're gonna have nobody left up here to crew.  Better let Skipper know. Bill nods and disappears.  John joins Chuck watching the events around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well Gieg, I'm glad to see I'm not the only guy on this boat that can take a little rock'n roll.  Bunch of wusses, I swear...! Chuck watches each of his shipmates.  Then, suddenly, out of nowhere -- Projectile vomit all over John.  He looks at Chuck, horrified, then he too, cuts loose over the rail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch!! Chuck looks at John, furious with himself, and begins to laugh.  But after a moment he starts to laugh too.  It's infectious, they crack each other up.  Then, in the middle of belly laughing, they simultaneously retch again over the side. INT.  SKIPPER'S CABIN - DAY Skipper sits at his desk with some charts spread out in front of him.  There's a knock on the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skipper, uh, the crew is pretty much doing group boot over the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's all part of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got weather moving in from the west. Skipper looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's part of it, too. EXT.  DECK - DUSK Skipper stands at the wheelhouse with Lawford, George and Bill, studying the horizon through binoculars.  Dark clouds.  Chuck watches Skipper.  Everyone, looking for a cue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That a... storm, Skipper? Skipper stays glued to the binoculars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you, um, say it's a big storm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes it gets exciting out here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barometer's dropping.  The first blow'll come from the south.  Might get interesting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shouldn't we turn away?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't run from the wind son. You trim your sails, face the music and let the chips fall.  Bill, let's close her up, dog, tight. Close on hatches and skylights slamming closed and cinched tight. BELOW DECKS Bulkhead doors are closed and cranked down tightly. IN THE GALLEY Pots and pans crash around. IN THE MAIN CABIN The cabin doors on the bookcase swing open and dump books on top of Alice.  She turns and looks at the mess, annoyed. EXT.  DECK - SAME SKIPPER Furl the squares, reef the main, and bend on the storm jib, but keep it furled.  Drop everything but the inner jib.  I want everybody down before we get any lightning. Bill bolts forward with Lawford barking orders.  Most of the crew are still ill, but climb into the rigging and begin dropping sail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why's it always happen at night? Skipper regards George, annoyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: George... I want hot food in everybody.  Get to it. George returns to the galley.  Alice joins Skipper at the wheelhouse handing him foul-weather gear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like weather.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yep. He slips on a yellow slicker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do me a favor and tell Bill once she's dogged down I want everyone to break out their slickers and make sure their gear is stowed or we'll spend the next week sorting underwear. (to the others) Lawford, Bill, Mike, John, and Phil will stand the watch.  Everyone else hit the racks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (impulsively) I'm not staying out here. Skipper fires off a look that frightens even Phil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  That's for sure.  Charlie, take his place. Phil goes below, a little ashamed.  The crew scatters. Chuck, still at the wheel, pipes up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it's all the same, I'd like to stay on deck. Skipper regards Chuck, who looks back with both fear and eagerness.  Suddenly he sees something in this kid.  Maybe himself.  He almost smiles.  Almost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take the wheel. EXT.  FORETOP - SAME Dark clouds blot out the sky and stars.  Thunder rumbles far away.  The seas have built but there's no wind... yet. With no steerage, the ship is tossed. Tod hangs high above the heaving deck continuing to furl. The mast swings from side to side, but the air has gone dead calm.  Skipper looks up, anticipating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone out of the rigging NOW!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody down!  ON THE DOUBLE!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shouting)
direction.name: direction

result.heading: CAPTAIN'S WIFE AND SHIP'S SURGEON OF THE BRIGANTINE ALBATROSS

dialogue.raw_text: : EXT.  FOREST - WATER TOWER - DAY A towering monolith, surrounded by tall oaks and sycamores.  The tower is immense.  A single ladder runs up to the top. AT THE TOP Just above the tree tops, the view is spectacular.  CHUCK GIEG, 16, sits thin and unsteady.  Chuck's gaze is drawn upward -- to the building spring cumulus clouds.  Chuck's older brother WILL, 18, stout, self assured, pulls himself to the top.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: !! ON THE DECK The crew in the rigging scamper down to the safety of the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill, on the wheel with Chuck. Bill joins Chuck and takes hold of the wheel.  Then it hits. A wall of torrential rain drums the deck amid a tympany of thunder and flashing lightning.  The bow explodes through twelve foot swells.  This is what the Albatross was born to do. INT.  MAIN CABIN - SAME It's all the crew can do to stay in their bunks.  Pots crash, books and personals go flying.  The guys are scared. ON DECK The main and jib sheets tighten.  Skipper looks at Chuck and Bill.  It all comes down to moments like these and he loves it. Suddenly, there is a loud CRACK!  A violent flapping noise.  Skipper leaps to the port and looks forward.  Tod comes running back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We blew the inner!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring it down and run up the storm jib.  We'll fix it later.  Stay out of reach of the blocks! Tod and Alice disappear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a twinkle) Well, we're in it now. Chuck studies him, frightened, but reassured. EXT.  BOW - SAME The shredded jib and rigging whip violently in the wind. The block smashes into the gunnel rail, shattering it.  No one dares go near it.  For a moment, it seems to hang there seductively.  John, naive of its power, leaps for the rail and grabs it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! Suddenly, the wind cracks the sail instantly hurling John high off the deck and over the side.  He holds on for dear life, screaming. AT THE WHEEL SKIPPER (to Chuck) Hold her steady. Skipper bolts forward. AT THE BOW Alice uncleats the jib halyard, leaving one turn on the pin and shoves it into Tod's hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Release this when I tell you!! Skipper joins Tod as Alice scrambles along the deck and pulls herself into the bowsprit netting.  When the block and jib swing inboard, she grabs for the leach of the sail yelling...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! As John is snapped inboard Alice leaps up, grabbing the sail, leaning out over the open water.  Waves explode through the netting.  As Tod releases the halyard, John falls to the deck, bruised, humbled, but alive.  Lawford and Skipper pull Alice from the bowsprit. Skipper looks her over.  Relieved.  No broken bones.  Good work.  But then this is what he expects.  He respects her and now, everyone can see why.  He looks at John sprawled on the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be careful will ya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What ever you say Cap...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get that storm jib up. Skipper gives Alice a private look, then returns to the stern where Chuck holds tightly onto the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The storm lasted sixteen hours and it set us all on equal footing.  It was the first time that we shared an episode on an even plane.  As we stood our watches we were equally out of control of our situation, regardless of our physical abilities or social backgrounds.  And though our real feelings lay hidden beneath bravado and defiance, we were no longer strangers. EXT.  DECK - DAY The crew is cleaning up.  Alice supervises repairs to the jib while others stow line, scrub the deck and chip paint. Lawford paces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what they say in the Navy don't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that, Big Daddy? The more experienced crew members have heard this all before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "If it moves, salute it.  If it doesn't move, pick it up.  If it's too big to pick up, paint it!" The boys mockingly salute Lawford as he walks by.  John stands before a porthole combing his Brylcreem hair into a "D.A." Mike and Chris climb on deck with several large boxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies, gentlemen and hermaphrodites, Mr. Corry and I are happy to announce the grand opening of Trans-Border Enterprises. They start opening the boxes.  One is a case of Coca Cola, another is full of cigarettes and candy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All of the creature comforts and vices you could possibly want, at home or abroad, available twenty- four hours a day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a price, of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you've got "a broad" available I'll take her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like you'd know what to do with one. The crew shakes their heads, mutter and check out the goods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got Marlboro's?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absa-fuckin-lutely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toss me a Cola.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifty cents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Contraband's hard to come by out here son. John is still grooming at the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Goodall, you got a date or something? John continues to comb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  With your mom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oooooooo. Phil slinks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We also have a few rental items... Chris displays a Playboy magazine.  Everybody clamors to get a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a penalty for any material returned to the Trans-Border Library with sticky pages. John walks by, snatches the magazine and heads for his bunk flipping through the pages.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you can't do that!! (to Chris) He can't do that!! John flops in a deck chair.  Chris shakes his head and starts closing up the boxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure he can. EXT.  STERN - LATER Chuck sits alone, away from the others, reading.  On cue, half of the crew descend, dragging him kicking and screaming into the bowswain's chair, and over the side. The guys cheer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on you guys, this isn't funny! The seat spins, twists and swings from behind the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on Chucky.  Show us a little grit. They lower the chair so it glides just above the surface. When the boat noses into a swell Chuck gets quite a ride. Once he has the hang of it, fear turns to elation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, who's next?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gotta be kidding?  He's a human chum line!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No self respecting shark is gonna take a bite out of you. Chuck's hauled back in and Terry pushes his way to the front of the line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm next! Terry goes over the side.  Once he gets the hang of it, he gets into it.  He maneuvers the chair like a plane, forcing himself deep into the waves and then blasting back to the surface. OFF THE PORT SIDE Robin is trolling.  The line takes a tremendous hit and Robin's reel screams.  Tod is at the wheel and turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There she blows!! Two hundred feet out something large and pissed has taken the bait.  The crew turn and look.  Skipper looks out at Terry still in the bowswain's chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get him in. Bill waves at Terry to come on in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on in!!! Terry waves him off and disappears back under the waves. They can't pull him up while he's going under the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it now Bill. Terry pops up, pissed that they're reeling him back in. Suddenly the animal on the other end of Robin's line explodes out of the sea.  It's a six foot Thresher shark. Terry sees it too and freaks, suddenly thrashing and screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get me out!!!  Get me out!!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my god!!  It's a...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calmly) Shark. (to Robin) Don't lose it son. George grabs a gaffing hook while Robin fights the rod, trying to bring in the big fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep it coming. Robin battles the fish.  George clumsily tries to help. The crew make their way to the rear to watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoops. Charlie and Rick and the others heave to get Terry up. Finally he makes it.  Sprawling onto the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Jesus!  Oh Jesus Christ!! The crew turn and cheer Robin on as he brings the shark alongside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He must be two hundred pounds! Bring him in close and try to hold him steady. George leans out over the rail, trying to get the hook into a gill.  Several of the boys hold onto him as the fish flops around violently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got him! Skipper comes down to inspect the catch.  The shark is longer than Terry is tall and thrashes in the the water, snapping and twisting.  Terry stands shaking, freaked. All of them are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn Terr, you're whiter than Sister Mary Anne's butt. The guys laugh nervously.  Terry just stares at the man eater, but it's infectious.  After a moment he's laughing too.  Skipper slaps him on the back with a wry smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, now you have something to write home about. More laughter.  Suddenly, Tom, who is lookout on the foretop, cries out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Land ho!!!  Land ho!!! Everyone turns around to look.  The guys at the stern let go of George and he nearly tumbles overboard.  In that instant, the shark slips off of the gaff, and disappears back into the sea.  Robin and George share a stunned look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's more where that came from. Skipper returns to the wheelhouse with Alice.  Together they scan the horizon.  Clouds build over the land ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cheated death again. He slips an arm around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yep. EXT.  ANTIGUA - HARBOR - DAY A group of islanders have assembled to watch the crew approach in the long boats. INT.  LONG BOAT - SAME Chuck gazes across the strange landscape.  As the boats dock, the crew pile out and scatter.  Local children follow them wherever they go.  Chuck, Robin and John find themselves alone.  Most of the buildings are primitive. They wander over to a shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you say?  Cokes?  I'm buying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. EXT.  SHOP Chuck and Robin reappear, sipping cold Cokes.  Mike and Chris walk by across the street.  Robin speaks up loud enough for them to hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right Chuck.  There's nothing quite as refreshing as a cold ten cent Coke that only costs ten cents! The three clink their bottles.  Mike and Chris slink away. EXT.  COLONIAL FORT - DAY A crumbling fort overlooks the harbor.  Below, the Albatross floats like a pearl on the azure blue water. Large bronze muzzle-loading cannons still lie in their gunports, aimed at the sea, waiting for pirate ships that will never come. Each of the guys are sprawled on a cannon, taking in the Caribbean view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think Skipper and Alice do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ya know... "It".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's like wondering if your mom and dad do it.  Who wants to know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She isn't that old.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean she looks pretty damn good in her all-together for being thirty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How would you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trust me donut.  I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?  Come on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the dog watch, night after the storm, I look down into the skylight above Skipper's cabin and there she was, peelin' down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on man, what'd they look like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn, Porkchop, you sound just like a guy who ain't never seen a pair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've seen 'em.  I've seen 'em. They crack up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I walked in on my parents one time. It was only like eight o'clock and they were in bed and I thought that was kinda weird so I just walked in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what they get for not locking the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I'm standing there and you could hear a pin drop.  No breathing or snoring... Suddenly it hits me that somethin' was goin' on that just stopped, really fast, like people are holding their breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So... What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My mother says in this really low, but very awake kind of voice "What?" John and Robin crack up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said "Sorry, wrong room" and walked away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you shut the door at least? They bust up again.  Chuck glares back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't remember. Robin sits up on his cannon and looks out, suddenly melancholy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My parents don't do it anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know?  They might.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cause they're getting a divorce. (beat) That's why they sent me here.  My sister's at Tabor.  They just wanted us out of the house so they could get down to business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They tell you that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I figured it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My old man split along time ago.  It doesn't mean anything.  You just take care of number one that's all that matters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It matters to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (kindly) Okay donut.  Whatever you say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We better get back. Robin looks up to John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you really see 'em. EXT.  ALBATROSS - HARBOR - NIGHT The boat moves off leaving the lights of Antigua behind. Chuck watches as the island disappears below the horizon. EXT.  DECK - DAY The wind is up and the seas are high.  The ship is under full sail driving at top speed.  Foam sprays from the bow as it slices through the water -- what she was born to do. The crew line the starboard rail, thrilled to be part of the performance. Tod is at the wheel with Chris nearby.  The sails tower above him like a mountain of silk.  He wrestles the wheel, careful to hold his course against the powerful trade winds. Skipper, making his rounds inspects the heading on the compass and nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a good sail boys. Tod and Chris beam.  Compliments are rare from this man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, sir.  Shall we trim the main Skipper?  I think we could get another knot or two. Skipper turns and looks at Tod, a twinkle in his eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As you like. Gravy.  The two gloat as they lighten the mainsheet tackle.  Phil joins them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you say I have a crack at the wheel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd say, fuck off junior. They laugh.  Phil slinks behind the chart house, hurt, and angry.  He spots a spear gun stowed against the chart house. As Tod and Chris pull in the main, it strains and stretches against the powerful wind. Phil aims the spear gun at the mainsail from behind the chart house and silently fires.  There is a wicked POP as the spear punctures the sail, passing through it, followed by a loud shredding as the huge sail splits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ!!  Let it out.  Let it out!! The sound brings Skipper onto the deck like a shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hard to port!  Hard to port!! Calamity, as Tod cranks the ship into the wind.  The canvas goes limp as the ship hauls to a dead stop.  People dive everywhere to drop sail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Start the engine.  All ahead full!! Scallop the Square and drop the rest!! He shoots a glare at Tod and Chris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bewildered) I don't know what happened Skipper. It just blew out. Skipper turns to the task at hand without a word.  What had been praise is now reduced to embarrassment and confusion. Phil, still hidden behind the chart house returns the spear gun and smiles to himself at Tod's arrogance turned humility. EXT.  DECK - TOBAGO CAYS - DAY The Albatross has dropped anchor along a remote group of flat, lush atolls.  Tall palm trees grow almost to the waters edge.  The crew have the mainsail down and Alice supervises the repair of the sail.  Phil sits above it all sunning himself in the bowswain's chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you from any way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Depths of hell... Ohio.  How 'bout you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kennet Square, PA.  'Mushroom capital of the world'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry to here it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, and it's pretty cool too, ya know?  Bein' here together an all... Phil reels himself down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Christ, I'm gonna choke on 'feel good'... Robin looks up, taken back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you such a penis Phil.  Do you do it on purpose or can't you help it.
