direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tug my chain Johnstone. Skipper comes on deck.  Robin and Chuck flip Phil and Terry the finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After midterms we'll finish our run down to Curacao. The crew reacts, grumbling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have arranged to host a good will cruise for the Dutch students of the local school there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Terry) Joy, rapture...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Each one of you will be responsible for one student.  I'll expect you to be courteous.  You represent this school and your country.  We'll sail in the morning. George appears from the galley and rings the ships bell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's chow. The crew drop what they're doing and stampede down into the cabin. INT.  CABIN - NIGHT Robin thrashes in his bunk calling out.  Sweat glistens on his face.  Chuck stumbles out to his bunk with Rick and some of the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey man, wake up.  Wake up! They shake him.  Robin wakes, disoriented, eyes filled with tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was falling... Phil grumbles from his bunk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, shut up will ya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was a bad dream...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was so real...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's the thing; whenever you're having a nightmare, all you have to do is say 1-2-3 wake up!  You'll be out of it.  You'll wake up. Phil rolls over in his bunk trying to go back to sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who told you that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It works?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swear to God.  Only good advice he ever gave me.  Now, go back to sleep. He pats Robin on the leg.  The guys return to their bunks. Favor Phil, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (lingering) You okay now? Robin stares at the photo of his brother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how he died you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My brother.  He fell out of the old beech tree.  Broke his neck.  I was on a camp out.  They started going at it, throwin' things, a real knock down... (beat) They didn't find him 'till the next morning.  They didn't even know why he was up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, you never told them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I couldn't. Phil stares at the ceiling, affected by what he has overheard.  Someone creeps down the companionway and whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hushed) Hey you guys, come on! Shuffling in the darkness.  Phil suddenly realizes, he's alone. EXT.  DECK - NIGHT The dory hangs from her gallows.  Some of the guys slowly lower her to the water. INT.  GALLEY - SAME George is asleep with a book in his lap.  Mike and Chris slip inside.  The door squeaks, George stirs.  Mike opens a cabinet and removes a fifth of rum. Silently, Mike passes the bottle to Chris who passes it to Tod who passes it to Charlie who drops it down to Robin who stands in the lowered dory with Chuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think you're doing? Startled, Mike and Rick share a look.  Busted.  Phil turns and runs into John, wearing a broad smile, who shakes his head.  No way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it.  Count me out! The crew descend and drag Phil, struggling, into the dory. They raise a crude sailing rig and silently move off. A figure stands on top of the chart house, back lit by the moon.  It's Skipper.  Watching it all.  Letting it unfold. INT.  GALLEY - NIGHT Skipper hovers over George, sawing logs.  He tosses a pot on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bolting up) What?!  What's happening?!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're officer of the watch, George.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Skip.  It's this damned book.  Lawford gave it to me. The book is "Kafka".  Skipper motions to the empty cabinet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son-of-a-bitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're short one long boat too.  Come on. EXT.  CAMPFIRE - NIGHT The boys sit in a circle around a small fire passing the bottle.  Rick strums his guitar and sings while the rest join in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh I was walkin' down Lime street one day...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!  Weigh!  Blow the man down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pretty young maiden she happened my way...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me some time to blow the man down... Skipper and George crawl to the top of a sand dune and watch the boys.  George starts to stand but Skipper puts a hand on his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess we know what the next acquisition for the galley is going to be...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A padlock. On the boys.  Phil is drunkest of them all and does a wild jig as the rest of them sing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So to all you sailors who've fought wind and whale...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weight!  Hey!  Blow the man down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She said "None the better, you all go to hell..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me some time to Blow the man down! They all crack up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I only have one question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that, Canuck?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we're not on the boat, how come the ground is moving?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think George'll miss the bottle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll blame it on Big Daddy.  He's a lush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I know is if that Viking son of a bitch puts me on smegma duty one more time I'm gonna have to run him through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mimicking) The "Old Man" likes a tight ship!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "If it moves, shoot it..." The rest join in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "If it doesn't move, throw it overboard.  If it's too big to throw overboard, screw it!" More laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think Old Thunder Nuts will figure out that we're A.W.O.L. Bill drunkenly imitates the Skipper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "There is nothing that goes on, on this boat that I don't know about. She speaks to me in the night.  So don't test me.  Not even a little..." The boys laugh.  On the dune, George shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Immortality.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spirits have a way of bringing that out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And being sixteen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're in a hurry to grow up.  They don't know about consequences or responsibility.  That's being sixteen too. (beat) I promise you one thing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They'll know about it in the morning. Skipper smiles. EXT.  BEACH - NIGHT The drunken crew stumble out of the woods onto the beach. As they ready the boat for the trip back Robin looks out to sea...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (alarmed) Jesus H. Christ. Tod looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What now pork chop?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look! The guys turn their gaze to the ocean.  The Albatross... is gone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy shit!  Where'd she go? The crew is suddenly stone sober.  Stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is going on?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's gone!  The boat's gone!! Phil breaks into sort of a blind panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Jesus, oh Jesus.  Man I knew we shouldn't have gone.  I tried to tell you.  I tried to tell you.  You guys made me come!  You made me come!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you shut up?  You sound like my fucking sister.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright.  Everybody just stay cool. We'll figure this out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who the hell checked the mooring?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did.  Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe she pulled free...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if they don't know.  If she's adrift, if they're asleep, she could run aground.  She could break up on the reef.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Robin) Maybe you didn't check it good enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (defensive, frightened) I did.  I swear. Oddly, it's Phil who stands up for Robin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well you're really gonna have some bad dreams if we find out you didn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How the hell are we gonna get outta here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll think of something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, praise the lord. (announcing) Relax everybody.  Everything is under control.  The jug head's going to think of something. Without warning.  John lunges at Phil.  Phil screams, trying to defend himself.  The guys all dive in.  Suddenly it's an all out brawl. John out of control pounding Phil's head against the seat of the boat. Suddenly, from behind, comes a blistering "THWACK!!" as Chuck breaks an oar over the back of John's head. Stunned, John lets go of Phil and turns, blood dripping from the back of his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody calls me an idiot. He weaves, then passes out, falling face down in the sand. The guys stagger to their feet, trying to recover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God damn it man.  I think he broke my nose!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up, Phil. Chuck tosses the broken oar handle, kneels over and vomits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well that's just great.  Now what are we supposed to do? Chuck and Robin hoist John up and drag him under a palm tree, propping him up.  The others huddle to stay warm. EXT.  BEACH - MORNING The crew's asleep in the tropical heat of day.  Bloodied and sun burned.  A fly buzzes around Rick's face, waking him.  He sits up sunburned and sore trying to focus.  He gazes across the water, stupefied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh-my-god... The others stir and follow his gaze.  The Albatross sits in exactly the spot where they left her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure if this is really good or really bad. EXT.  ALBATROSS - DAY The sound of a rod and reel spinning wildly.  George tries to maintain control as the rod nearly jumps out of his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a live one! Skipper, Alice and Bill watch the shoreline as the boys launch the long boat into the surf.  George is struggling. A beautiful tarpon leaps out of the water, but Skipper never takes his eyes off of his boys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The thing about fishing George, is you need to let 'em run some.  Give 'em just enough slack so they don't break the line.  But at the same time you've gotta keep enough tension to wear 'em down, bring 'em in slowly so they don't really know they're hooked. Suddenly George's line goes slack.  He nearly falls over backwards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll try and remember that. EXT.  DECK - DAY Hound dog and hung over, bloodied and burned, the boys stand before Skipper and the others.  Skipper looks dark and angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what a loose cannon is? 'Bout the worst thing that could happen to a wooden ship.  All it took was one, crashing around the deck in a storm... It'd smash everything in its way, maybe take out a mast or punch a hole right through the hull.  Think about it, just one cannon not tied down, not anchored, could take a whole 'Man of War' straight to the bottom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (aside) But we don't have any cannons? Chris jabs him in the ribs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hushed) Shut up! Skipper turns and faces them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, if the Skipper were smart, if he could see a storm building, why he'd cut loose every gun on his boat.  Even though it would leave him at a disadvantage in battle, he'd push 'em into the sea.  Better chance running for port than risk the entire ship, his crew. He takes a pause making sure he has their attention for this part.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People are like that sometimes. They cut loose and before you know it, they're knocking holes in everything.  So you gotta ask yourself if it might not be better to just put 'em off before they sink the whole thing.  I mean after all, you can always get new cannons. He walks back to his place at the rail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (beat) I want a tight ship, everybody shaved and in clean clothes when we make Curacao.  If it goes well, if your mid terms are acceptable, I may reconsider my decision about the rest of the trip.  That's all. Dejected, the crew goes below. EXT.  DECK - DAY Under sail.  Skipper stands at the wheel overseeing the crew taking exams.  Each writes furiously as Alice scribbles problems on the blackboard which hangs from the chart house door. As the boys scratch out the problems, John seems paralyzed.  He looks over at Phil and copies down his answer.  He checks crib notes hidden in his shorts.  Chuck and Robin both see this and exchange looks. INT.  AFT CABIN - DAY John makes his way down the narrow corridor towards the head.  Robin follows.  Chuck drops down the aft companionway, intercepting John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To take a piss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? John turns around, surprised, sandwiched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, that's right.  You wanna come in and shake it for me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're gonna cheat, you might as well copy off somebody who's gonna get the answer right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've gotta be kidding.  Get the fuck outta my way! Chuck throws open the Engine Room door and they shove John inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell!!! Chuck manages to pin John.  Robin checks his pockets and comes up with the crib notes.  Chuck lets go.  John snatches them, ashamed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Takin' a piss? John turns away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why, man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't have to listen to this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you do, stupid.  Because if you don't, I'm gonna go right up there and have a heart to heart with Skipper and you'll be on the first plane back to idiotville. John lunges at Chuck, sending them both sprawling.  Robin leaps on top of John.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut it out man!!  Stop it!!!  What's the matter with you?  If Phil had caught you he'd have ratted you out in a second.  You get caught cheating, you'll get kicked off the boat. John explodes, tears flowing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I cheated to get on the boat!!!  All right?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? He lets go of Chuck and stands up trying to hide his emotions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I doctored my grades so I'd make the cut.  I'm a moron, okay?  You satisfied?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not a moron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wanna bet?  Takes me half a day to get through one chapter of Lawford and I still don't have any idea what the hell he's talkin' about.  You know why it takes me so long to write papers?  because I can't spell.  While everybody else is sleeping, I'm in the rack with a flashlight and a dictionary. John chokes back a sob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, they even kicked me outa vo- tech 'cause I couldn't read a slide rule.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can show you how to use a slide rule. The three turn around, startled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long you been standing there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long enough. John looks down, resigned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were gonna put me into special- ed this year.  I stole a copy of my transcript, changed all the grades. Shit, who am I kidding.  I'll never pass the boards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, you don't cheat, and we'll make sure you get the grades.  We'll start a private study group.  Nobody knows.  You'll ace that test.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm in. They turn and look to Phil, who still shows the tell-tail signs of their fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why would you do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because we believe in you. (beat) Because we're your friends. EXT.  CURACAO - HARBOR - DUSK As a blazing sun sizzles into the western sea, the Albatross rounds a point and heads towards the docks several hundred yards away.  On the dock, the students of the school wait.  As soon as the ship is in view, they start to cheer.  Chuck squints.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are they doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't make it out? Robin calls up to Phil, who is at the wheelhouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Phil... Swing up the 'binocs' and tell us what you see. Phil picks up the binoculars and focuses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (puzzled) They're waving... handkerchiefs or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe they're surrendering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a second... Phil lowers the binoculars and turns to Skipper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're girls!  They're all girls! Skipper shares a knowing look with Alice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme those. Tod snatches the binoculars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!!!!!  WOMEN!!! Everyone on board rushes to the port side.  Every single person on the dock is a young girl waving a white handkerchief.  Spontaneous cheers from the boys. As the 'Big A' pulls to the dock, John and Tod run for the gunnel door and swing it open.  The girls flood the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning, ladies. They chatter in Dutch and hurry aboard.  Like wall flowers, Robin, Phil and Chuck stand on top of the chart house watching utopia unfold before them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are we supposed to talk about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've gotta be kidding?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, they don't speak English.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are some things that everybody does in the same language.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, but how are you supposed to make the first move?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like this! Phil reaches up for a free line.  With a running start he swings out over the water...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeeee Haaaaa!! He careens back onto the deck and lands in front of two startled, but impressed girls.  Robin and Chuck applaud. Phil takes a bow.  All hell is breaking loose. Skipper and Alice welcome aboard the headmaster, MS. BOYDE, 50's, dumpy but tough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A very enthusiastic welcome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't often have guests.  Our girls have been looking forward to your visit for some time.  Welcome to Curacao.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.  You're all ready to sail then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should think so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure they won't be disappointed. A man's voice bellows up from the dock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahoy there!! Everyone stops and freezes.  Phil turns, disbelieving. It's his parents, Francis and PEGGY BOUTILLIER, standing next to a limousine dressed in brightly colored tourist garb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surprise!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, well.  What do we have here? A floating brothel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cool) Hardly. Francis comes aboard uninvited as usual.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we thought we'd drop in and see if you were all still in one piece.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointed) And, of course, we are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you never can tell these days, can you? Skipper shoots a look over at Phil who is staring a hole in the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it we can do for you today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we've come to give our boy a little break from the monotony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not monotonous. Francis flushes red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never the less... He turns and joins Peggy on the dock.  Phil is suddenly full of rage.  This is an invasion of his privacy. Everyone feels it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hop to boy.  We haven't got all day. Phil's anger turns to resigned humiliation.  He stops, staring down at his parents.  Skipper puts a hand on his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know, Phil. Phil nods, head down and walks down the ramp.  All watch him go, feeling for him. EXT.  OPEN WATER - DAY The sails begin to rise but unlike earlier, the guys SING out like the Vienna Boys Choir and it's having the desired impressive effect on the women.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When the sun came up there was whisky in the cup/ and not one of us was sober/ Kerry thought she saw a picture, but it really was the sun/ then we knew the party was over... The weather was perfect, brisk and steady under the trade wind swells.  The voices trail away as the ship moves off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curacao seemed out of a dream, somehow make-believe.  But, as Ohio drew further and further away, it was home that began to seem unreal, drifting somewhere in the foggy reaches of our memories.  And I knew that each of us was falling in love. But not only with these wonderful women or the swaying palms and porcelain beaches... We were falling in love with the experience we were sharing, and with who we were becoming. INT.  MAIN CABIN - NIGHT The crew is getting ready for a farewell party.  Each member is primping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bregitta.  Do you believe it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her name. (savoring the sound) Bregitta.  It's poetry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soon as we ship it'll be "forgetta".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't mind him, Chucky.  You're talking to a guy whose idea of big romance is a palm full of Vaseline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Screw you, Valentino.  I haven't seen you swapping spit with anybody. Tod smiles as he slowly pulls something from his pocket. It's a pair of girls' cotton underwear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's because I'm discrete, moron. The guys try to wrestle the underwear away from him.  Just then Skipper descends the companionway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, gentlemen, we sail with the tide.  Twenty-three hundred.  Sharp. I'm not waiting.  Have a good time tonight but be back on time. The crew cheer.  This means the trip goes on. EXT.  SCHOOL - GARDENS - NIGHT Decorated with colored paper lanterns and streamers, a STEEL DRUM BAND softly plays in the b.g.  The crew slow- dance with their girls, dressed in cotton that seems to glow against their dark skin. Ms. Boyde is scrutinizing the body contact between Chuck and BREGITTA.  Their lips appear pasted together and she doesn't like it.  Lawford sees what is about to happen and hands his slimy cigar to George who reacts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold this, will ya? Lawford intercepts Ms. Boyde.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madam, I would consider it a privilege if you would allow me to take you on a tour of the dance floor. Ms. Boyde is so flattered, it is all she can do to extend her hand.  Lawford leads her away and glares at Rick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're very light on your feet Ms. Boyde.  Was it you who taught all of these young ladies the art of the dance? Ms. Boyde giggles like a school girl. EXT.  RESTAURANT - NIGHT Phil and his parents sit outside at a ritzy restaurant. Phil stares towards the harbor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong, you don't like steak?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should be eating with the crew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Humor me.  Eat it anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We missed you.  We wanted to check on you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't need you spying on me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spying?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can take care of myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sarcastic) Oh, really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, you put me on this boat in the first place.  I didn't want to come but I did.  Why do you have to embarrass me.  Why can't you just leave me alone? Francis slaps Phil across the face nearly knocking him out of his chair.  Everyone and everything.  It's humiliating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Francis!! She cradles Phil's red face.  He fights the tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to me, you thankless little prick.  We're your parents, so don't you dare talk to me disrespectfully. What the hell is it, this captain? Because I'll see him in a rowboat...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It has nothing to do with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what does it have to do with? Us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Look, it's me okay?  Can't it just be about me?  For once? Phil pulls free and exits.  He can feel eyes all over him. EXT.  SCHOOL - GARDENS - NIGHT Alice watches, swept up in the nostalgic romance of it all.  Skipper joins her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He would have loved this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All his years at sea, he never stopped talking about these islands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You miss him. Skipper manages a sad smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every hour.  Every minute. (pause) I wish he was here.  I wish he could have sailed our girl.  Seen these boys... She smiles warmly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd have liked to have said goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sound so sure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am about this. Skipper turns and stares at her deeply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He never would have believed a woman like you existed. Alice smiles and turns back to the dancers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you remember the last time you and I danced under the stars?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guilty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the deck of the Yankee, the night you asked me to marry you.  We weren't much older than they are. The music changes to a calypso waltz.  Skipper takes Alice by the hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you allow me? She's sixteen again.  There's something about him that still makes her blush. Skipper leads her to the dance floor.  He hesitates, looking deeply into her eyes.  As they begin to dance, the boys notice and exchange looks. Lawford and George sit across the quad, sipping punch and smoking cigars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I didn't know better I'd say the old man was acting almost halfway human.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is halfway human. One by one the couples clear for the Skipper and his bride.  They glide, lost in each others arms.  They dance a dance for the ages.  As if it might be for the last time.  The music swells. EXT.  PIER - NIGHT Chuck and Bregitta, are at the end of the pier, a full moon hangs above the horizon.  Bregitta doesn't understand what Chuck is saying, but it's clear she's enjoying him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't remember feeling like this about myself, a place, someone like you.  We've come such a long way, seen so much.  But nothing like this. Bregitta smiles and takes Chuck's hand.  He's nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not the best at expressing myself.  Maybe the only reason I can now is because I know you don't understand me. (beat) I like you so much.  Too much.  But how could I?  I mean, if we can't even communicate, how could I know you?  It's confusing.  We sail in an hour and I'll never see you again. Bregitta takes Chuck's face gently and kisses him tenderly.  Then, in perfect English...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like you, too. Chuck's eyes widen, astonished.  Bregitta smiles, takes Chuck by the hand, and leads him to a small covered boat moored to the pier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on.  We don't have much time. Blushing deeply, Chuck follows her into the boat. EXT.  STREET - SAME Robin walks down the street hand in hand with one of the girls.  A long string of colored lights illuminate the length of the street.  Robin clumsily tries to kiss the girl.  She laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (defensive) What? Suddenly there's a flash and the sound of breaking glass. Robin looks up to see Phil staggering, down the street, smashing each of the colored light bulbs with a stick.  He showers himself with broken glass and sparks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to girl) Wait for me okay.  I'll be right back.  I swear. She smiles sadly and nods.  Robin sprints down the pier and catches up with Phil.  His feet are bleeding.  He is completely smashed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil.  What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fandango, Junior. (he holds up his stick) I'm gonna do some limbo baby!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way Phil.  Not like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Roger Meris, steps up, it's a corker down the pipe... THWACK!  He scores another bulb.  Robin jumps out of the way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's outta here!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on man.  Let's just talk about it. The music drifts from the gardens ahead.  Phil bolts. Robin chases after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil!  Wait man... Come on... EXT.  SCHOOL - GARDENS - NIGHT John shares a joke with Lawford and George.  The calypso is cranking, but only John hears Phil and Robin crash into the refreshment table.  Robin struggles to stop Phil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Lawford) Be right back. Lawford nods, oblivious. ON THE GUYS John tries to help Robin with Phil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus!  What the hell happened to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lemme go!  Lemme go!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.  We gotta get 'im outta here before Skipper sees him like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Son of a bitch!! Phil kicks and struggles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil, if you don't calm down, I'm gonna hurt you.  Got it? They drag him into the darkness.  From near the bandstand however, Skipper has seen it all. EXT.  ALBATROSS - NIGHT The crew lean along the rail waving goodbye to the girls who wave back with their white handkerchiefs. INT.  MAIN CABIN - SAME Chuck and John hold Phil still as Robin picks shards of glass out of his feet.  Phil clenches his jaw, but his eyes are dry. EXT.  ALBATROSS - DAY The ship is under full-sail driving before a brisk following wind.  It takes two on the helm to keep her safely on course.  Those not on watch are sprawled about the boat, scraping and 'red-leading' or reading.  Chuck and Robin sit forward with John, studying.  Lawford paces the deck, chiding the crew.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rust won't wait for you to read Conrad, Goodall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then he shouldn't have written such a long poem, Mr. Lawford.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Read on, young John.  Read on. College boards are coming. John looks down, dejected.  Suddenly Tod cries from the foretop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There they blow!!  There they blow!! Dolphins off the bow!!! Everyone rushes to see.  Dolphins leaping out of the water.  It's a magnificent game they play with ships.  The crew cheers as each one explodes out of the sea, close enough to touch. Isolated, Phil watches.  Angry, cut off.  Chuck eyes him, worried. Bill and Charlie rig the bowswain's chair and lower Rick into the water.  Suddenly, the dolphins are everywhere. Rick pets them as they swim back and forth.  Shear joy. Phil reaches for the spear gun.  Nobody notices as he loads and takes aim. Suddenly... with a crack, everyone spins around.  A large female dolphin leaps out of the water, bloody foam spraying from her blow hole.  She lets out an agonizing scream.  Phil holds her fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ! The crew can only watch, stunned.  Phil is suddenly, defensive as if waking from a dream.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck off man.  It's just a fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Phil.  It's a mammal. Skipper steps on deck, sees the dolphin and Phil with the spear gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly) Bill, lower a long boat.  We'll bring her up with the davit. A dory is lowered with John and Bill inside.  Once near the water they maneuver the struggling dolphin into a canvas harness.  The crew hoist her with the davit tackle, swing her inboard, and gently lower her to the deck. They gather around the gasping animal.  Alice checks the wound.  Skipper kneels beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think? Alice shakes her head and gently strokes the dolphin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's through her lung. Skipper turns to Phil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Phil) Nice shot. Phil looks up at the crew but one by one they look away. Chuck finds this confusing and inexcusable but is the last to look away.  Skipper grimly walks over to one of the deck lockers and pulls out a large wooden mallet and holds it out to Phil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finish it. Phil looks at the mallet, horrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stammering) I'm not gonna kill it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You already have.  Now go on.  Do it. Phil backs away.  Skipper stares at him for a moment, then walks over to the dolphin.  Robin looks away.  The sickening sound of the mallet crushing the skull of the animal seems to silence the world.  There are one of two thumps of her tail and, it's over. Skipper tosses the bloody mallet into the locker and approaches Phil, his face flushed with anger.  He grabs the spear gun, and snaps it across his knee and throws the pieces into the sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell is wrong with you?! Phil begins to shake with rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on.  You got so much fight in you; you wanna kill something?  Take your best shot.  The first one's free. Robin holds his ears as if he can make it all go away. For a brief moment Phil looks as if he might take Skipper up on the challenge.  Then the impulse passes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I thought. (beat) You're done.  You're going home. Skipper turns.  The humiliation is more than Phil can take.  He lunges after Skipper.  Lawford grabs him.  Phil swings wildly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean-assed bastard!!  You son of a bitch!!  You can't do this!!!  You can't do this!!!  God damn you!! God damn you!! Lawford leads Phil, struggling, below.  The crew surround the dead dolphin, stunned. EXT.  ARUBA - ESTABLISHING - DAY The Albatross is at anchor in the center of the harbor. EXT.  DECK - SAME Phil comes on deck from below with his duffel bag. Everyone feels bad but no one knows what to say.  Phil turns to get a second load.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why'd you do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (regretting it) What's the difference?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You only hurt yourself you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like you really care.  Like any of you give a shit what happens to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the one who doesn't care, Phil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It hurts too much to care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About yourself?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About anything. Phil turns and disappears down the companionway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We shouldn't be putting him off the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guy's out of control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody's been outta control on this trip. (beat) Are we a crew or not?  I mean, isn't that what this is supposed to be all about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're the last person who should be whining about being a "crew".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you figure that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'd sure like to go into the subject of vertigo and all, but I wouldn't want you to piss yourself. Robin flushes bright red.  John fires a look at Mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a regular prick you know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell it to the dolphin, Goodall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody deserves a second chance, ya know?  We'd do the same for you Mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's about family isn't it?  I mean are we together on this or not? There is a long pause.  Mike and Chris cave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, do what ever you want.  It won't change anything anyway. Robin exchanges a glance with Chuck and together, they climb up the companionway. EXT.  CHART HOUSE - SAME Chuck and Robin stand before the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't go in there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about. Robin turns away, ashamed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The guys were right.  It'll mean nothing coming from me.  He'll listen to you Chuck.  Everybody does. INT.  CHART HOUSE - SAME Skipper and Alice have paperwork spread out in front of them.  A knock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come. Chuck enters, awkward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's on your mind?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here on behalf of the crew, sir. Skipper looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, spit it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fact is... We'd like you to give Phil another chance. Alice raises her eyebrows, surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Close the door.  Sit down. Chuck does as he is told.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you think I'm sending him home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He killed the dolphin. Skipper looks at Chuck for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Dolphin was a symptom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of a fight he can't win out here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's his father sir.  He's suffocating him.  We've all seen it... Suddenly it's as if Chuck is talking about his own life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean he has all these expectations and he doesn't even know who his own kid is.  What right did then have to show up here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They have every right Chuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They send us because they want us to change, or grow up or something and then they try to keep us the same. Skipper sits up and studies Chuck for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me tell you something about Phil's father, and your's too.  How do you think you got here?  You think this is all free, that they owe you something?  You think they enjoy riding subways and commuter trains, driving buses or pulling lobster traps?  Work fifty weeks a year to keep you in tennis shoes and private school?  Look around at how the rest of the world lives Chuck. We're the luckiest people alive, every one of us.  They gave it up for you and Phil, and me too my friend. Chuck chews on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are ground rules in families just like on this boat.  If you and Phil don't like it, I'm sorry. Someday you'll understand that, and if you're lucky, you'll come home and find your best friend has been there all along waiting for you to forgive him for being a father. It'll be the way it used to be, when you were ten and your dad was a giant. Now it's Skipper who is talking about himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does Phil know how you guys feel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should tell him.  That's something he can take with him. Chuck nods and leaves. EXT.  CHART HOUSE - SAME As Chuck exits he meets Robin's eyes.  He shakes his head. INT.  CHART HOUSE - SAME Skipper returns to his paperwork but can feel Alice watching him.  He senses it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm all ears. Alice smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You may not like what you hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can take it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've become what you wanted. They're a crew.  That's why he came. Skipper puts a loving hand on Alice's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did we begin this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were idealists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because we believed we could make an impact out here.  Self reliance and community through the disciplines of sailing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't forgotten.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil, he's not looking inside.  He's just striking out at the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has a lot of hurt inside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, he better learn to own it. Actions have consequences. (beat) It's not what happens here Alice, it's what they take away with them. Alice runs her hands across his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're still an idealist. Skipper turns and slips into her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh hell... EXT.  DECK - DAY Phil is in the long boat with Skipper, ready to shove off. Tension is high.  It's as though they're all waiting for Skipper to give Phil a reprieve.  But, it's not coming. They mumble goodbyes.  Terry and Rick pass down Phil's bags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck. Phil nods and turns to Skipper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm ready. Skipper starts to pull the oars to make the crossing to the dock as the crew watches them go.  Robin turns, staring at the ships bell. EXT.  DOCK - SAME Skipper ties off the boat and Phil hands up his bags.  A black limousine waits, brooding.  Phil climbs up with Skipper and stands, stares at it.  The back door opens, but nobody gets out. EXT.  ALBATROSS - SAME The crew stand, watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His ol' man's gonna eat him for lunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what that's like.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Then, suddenly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My god... All stares aloft.  In the rigging, climbing up the mast, is Robin.  With the ships bell in his teeth, he is sweating every rung.  Perspiration glistens on his brow. The crew watches, transfixed as he fights his way towards the foretop. EXT.  DOCK - SAME Phil turns to Skipper.  Working up some courage to say something, anything.  But all that comes out is...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. A pause between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, Phil. Skipper extends a hand and they shake.  Phil is about to turn, when a familiar sound draws their attention. EXT.  FORETOP - SAME Robin, holding on for dear life at the top of the mast, rings the ships bell triumphantly over his head, waving to Phil.  Victorious.  Ding ding!  Ding ding!  Ding ding! The crew begin to cheer. EXT.  DOCK - SAME Phil stares back, fighting his emotions.  Slowly he raises his hand in a single wave of acknowledgement.  The ringing stops as his eyes meet Robin's.  Waves back.  Skipper turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They never gave up on you, you know. Phil chews on it.  Then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell 'em I said... thanks. (beat) Goodbye Skipper. ROBIN'S POV Robin watches as the limo pulls away.  He rings the bell wildly.  The crew below wave in a show of silent protest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Robin rang him out, we waved in silent protest against Skipper's decision.  And in the days that followed the low morale was matched only by a sense of arrogance that perhaps the master should step down and let his students take over. AERIAL SHOT Robin, the Albatross and the drama unfolding below spin slowly away as we climb, turning, higher and higher. EXT.  ALBATROSS - ESTABLISHING - DAY Foam sprays from her bow as the Albatross slices through the swells. INT.  CABIN - SAME Tod exits the head with a worried look on his face.  He grabs Chuck by the arm and pulls him aside.  Morale is extremely low.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen man, I think I have a problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We all have problems.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm pissin' fire man. Chuck reacts. INT.  SKIPPER'S CABIN - DAY Tight on Alice.  Pull back to reveal Tod standing in front of her with his shorts down around his ankles.  Mortified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have a nice time in Curacao, did you Tod? Alice gets up and moves to her medicine chest.  Tod starts to pull up his shorts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not so fast. She pulls out a menacingly large looking hypodermic needle.  Tod's embarrassment turns to alarm. EXT.  DECK - LATER The crew stand in line, pissed.  Lawford and George man the deck with Skipper and exchange amused looks.  The door opens and Chris exits, red faced, rubbing his backside. He glares at Tod who sits on the paint locker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Way-ta-go Valentino.  I never even copped a feel in Curacao.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah well, your sexual orientation is not my problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, is there a social disease you haven't had?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So much for vestal virgins. Lawford swings up a pair of binoculars.  A vessel under power is coming up fast behind them.  He holds the binocs out to Skipper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you make of that? Skipper turns and looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. The ship pulls along the port side, keeping a couple hundred yards between them.  The boys move to the rail. George sees them first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus.  She's got guns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's Cuban. Everyone becomes alarmed.  Even Alice looks concerned. Suddenly a puff of smoke discharges from the gun boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shouting)
direction.name: direction
